narrative.title: NIH Data Management and Sharing Plan

question.text: Types and amount of scientific data expected to be generated in the project

json.answer: The study is expected to generate a large volume of multi-modal datasets, including demographic and clinical information, behavioral and cognitive assessments, neuroimaging and physiological measures, derived variables, and documentation (protocols, data dictionary, README). The estimated total size of the dataset will depend on the number of participants and duration of the study. We anticipate generating approximately [X] GBs of raw data per participant.

question.text: Scientific data that will be preserved and shared, and the rationale for doing so

json.answer: All scientific data collected in this project will be preserved and shared with the NIMH Data Archive (NDA) to facilitate future research and maximize the impact of our findings. The rationale for sharing is to provide a public resource for researchers interested in studying autism and social communication, which aligns with the NIH's commitment to promoting transparency and reproducibility.

question.text: Metadata, other relevant data, and associated documentation

json.answer:
The following metadata and associated documentation will be made accessible to facilitate interpretation of the scientific data:* 
Study protocols
Data collection instruments (e.g., questionnaires, rating scales)
Data dictionary
README file
Participant consent forms and assent documents

section.title: Element 2: Related Tools, Software and/or Code

question.text: Element 2: Related Tools, Software and/or Code

json.answer: The project will utilize a combination of commercial and open-source software for data collection and analysis. The specific tools used will depend on the study design and data type, but we anticipate using [list specific tools and software]. To ensure accessibility, we will provide documentation on how to access and use these tools.

The project will adhere to widely accepted standards for neuroimaging and behavioral data, including:* 
Neuroimaging: NIfTI format for structural and functional imaging data
Behavioral: standardized coding schemes (e.g., COBID) for clinical assessments
Clinical: use of LOINC codes for laboratory results*
*These standards enable interoperability with existing datasets and facilitate reuse by other researchers.

section.title: Element 4: Data Preservation, Access, and Associated Timelines

question.text: Repository where scientific data and metadata will be archived

json.answer: The NIMH Data Archive (NDA) is the designated repository for storing and sharing our research data. We will submit all scientific data and associated metadata to the NDA in a format compliant with their standards.

question.text: How scientific data will be findable and identifiable

json.answer: The scientific data will be findable and identifiable via the NDA's search interface using a persistent unique identifier (e.g., accession number). We will also utilize standard indexing tools, such as DOIs, to facilitate discovery.

question.text: When and how long the scientific data will be made available

json.answer: The scientific data will be made available in the NDA no later than the end of the project's performance period ( [date] ). Data will remain accessible for at least 10 years after submission. We anticipate updating the dataset periodically to include new participants or revised documentation.

section.title: Element 5: Access, Distribution, or Reuse Considerations

question.text: Factors affecting subsequent access, distribution, or reuse of scientific data

json.answer: The primary factor affecting access is the broad consent/assent obtained from human research participants, which authorizes sharing their data for research purposes. Additionally, we will adhere to applicable federal regulations and institutional policies regarding data use and disclosure.

question.text: Whether access to scientific data will be controlled

json.answer: Yes, access to the scientific data will be controlled, as it is stored in a secure repository (NDA) that requires approval for access. We will provide information on how to request access and obtain approval.

question.text: Protections for privacy, rights, and confidentiality of human research participants

json.answer:
To protect participant privacy and confidentiality, we will:* 
Use de-identification procedures (e.g., pseudonymization) when possible
Obtain Certificates of Confidentiality as necessary to protect sensitive information
Store data securely in accordance with NDA standards

section.title: Element 6: Oversight of Data Management and Sharing

question.text: Element 6: Oversight of Data Management and Sharing

json.answer: Compliance with this Plan will be monitored by the Principal Investigator, in collaboration with [list relevant personnel]. We anticipate regular meetings (e.g., quarterly) to review progress and address any issues related to data management and sharing. We will also maintain documentation on our compliance efforts and any deviations from this Plan.
